alert.note: Alert for North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 28 at 5:45PM ADT until October 29 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST SUNDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Life-threatening breaking waves between 10 to 12 feet, and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Beaches of San Juan and Vicinity, Northeast, North Central, and Northwest. * WHEN...High Surf Advisory through Sunday evening and High Risk of Rip Currents through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Rip currents that can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water where it becomes difficult to return to safety. Breaking waves that can cause beach erosion and wash people and pets off rocks and jetties.
info.instruction: There is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. If you become caught in a rip current, yell for help. Remain calm, do not exhaust yourself and stay afloat while waiting for help. If you have to swim out of a rip current, swim parallel to shore and back toward the beach when possible. Do not attempt to swim directly against a rip current as you will tire quickly. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity
